TopicTitle: Lost two good Kerbals last night.

Articles.Content:
I forgot to do a save before starting a re-entry procedure from my very first manned Mun mission.

Thought I would be ok using my last stage as an aerobrake, it flipped on its side and all was gone within 2 to 3 seconds.

I’m gonna miss Jeb and Bill.

Edited October 16, 2020 by Dave Kermin

I am sorry to hear of the loss of two amazing kerbals. May they never be forgotten.

Yes, Jeb was the real loss here.

I was still somewhat early on in my first career attempt.

I feel like starting over.

Sad to hear it. I haven't played in a while and did not realized capsules now have a relative wing area associated with them. SO, I built my typical SpaceX SSTO, but as usual, did not add a heat shield on the payload stage. When I returned from Minmus, my craft flips over, nose first and dove straight into the ground, killing Jeb.

It seems head shield now have that relative wing area and is the only way to keep a spacecraft pointed the right way. AFAIK.

1 hour ago, Zamolxes77 said:

It seems head shield now have that relative wing area and is the only way to keep a spacecraft pointed the right way. AFAIK.

Heatshields have both a mass offset factor and lift values, because the aerodynamics model is too stupid to account for natural stability the shape of the craft should provide (or notice overall craft shape at all for that matter). Installing a heatshield on a pod will artificially move both the CoM and CoP of the system to make it stable.
